questDatabase.name: Tanning Leather
questDatabase.description: Leather is a useful resource, but before we can use it, we must tan the hide. Make a tanning rack and place Raw Hide onto it, over time, the hide will turn into leather!

questDatabase.name: Decocraft
questDatabase.description: If you wanted to decorate your surroundings, make this bench.

questDatabase.name: Tool Tinkering
questDatabase.description: Tools can have special effects applied to them by adding certain items to them in an anvil. Highlight over any tool, then press shift and control to see what possible upgrades the tool has.

questDatabase.name: Hardened Leather
questDatabase.description: Hardened leather makes for great armor. The wax used to harden the leather can be made by breeding Pam's Harvestcraft Bees in a Pam's Harvestcraft Apiary.

questDatabase.name: Milling Ores
questDatabase.description: You can double the amount of metal you get from ores by building a windmill. You can also grind bones into bonemeal, and sugarcane into sugar! Follow the guide to building windmills in the guides section of your inventory.

questDatabase.name: Sifting Tiny Dusts
questDatabase.description: Placing a sifter underneath the wooden hopper at the bottom of your windmill will automatically combine 8 tiny metal dusts into 1 regular dust. These dusts can be pulled from the sifter via a hopper.

questDatabase.name: Making Coal Coke
questDatabase.description: To make coal coke, you'll need to first make a coke oven. Coal coke is made by placing coal in the coke oven, and waiting. Coal coke burns longer than coal, and is used in making steel. Creosote Oil is a byproduct of creating coal coke or charcoal in the coke oven, and can be used to treat wood, or as liquid fuel. Check the Engineer's Manual you received for completing the last quest to see how to build the Coke Oven multiblock structure.

questDatabase.name: Leaving the bunker.
questDatabase.description:
Good morning! It's been <REDACTED> centuries since you entered cryosleep. There's nothing for you to live off of down here, so let's get you into the world! Enter the pin 8937 to leave your cryocell, then find the teleporter and use it to leave the bunker. The world is a very dangerous place, make sure you leave during the day!

NOTE: This quest is primarily for server owners who have created their own first-spawn bunker. If you are in singleplayer, or if your server does not have a spawn bunker, simply check the checkbox to the right.

questDatabase.name: Shelter!
questDatabase.description:
The world is a very dangerous place, especially at night. Building a shelter should be your highest priority. Wood will do nicely for now, be careful to not burn it down with a torch!

NOTE: Undead are smart, they can use buttons, levers, and doors. They will actively seek light sources to break! Additionally, they will dig through cobblestone, dirt, gravel, and sand,to reach you. Build your first shelter out of wood!

questDatabase.name: A Bed
questDatabase.description:
Even insomniacs need a place to rest from time to time.

NOTE: Night can't be slept away, but beds work as spawnpoints if you die!

questDatabase.name: Finding Ores
questDatabase.description: Finding ores is a bit harder than in Vanilla Minecraft. Ores generate in rare, but massive veins which can travel thousands of blocks. Some veins even branch out from a massive motherlode of ore!  It'll take some time for you to find your first vein, but after that, you're set. To start looking for veins, as well as to get your first iron dusts, you'll need to make a sluice. Next, you'll need to find a poorjoe flower. If the flower was naturally generated, or freshly made by bonemeal, that means there's iron ore somewhere within 30 blocks of the flower.

questDatabase.name: Safe Lighting
questDatabase.description: Having a light source that won't burn down your house or extinguish after a few hours would be nice.

questDatabase.name: Obtaining Ore
questDatabase.description: Now that we have found a poorjoe, and have a sluice ready, let's sluice for iron dust! Open your inventory, and click the "Guides" button to the left of your character portrait, then follow the sluice guide. Do note however, the sluice is slow, you'll want to find that iron vein before too long so that you can easily get as much ore as you need.

questDatabase.name: Iron Age!
questDatabase.description: We have a house, we have some iron, It's time to leave the stone age.

questDatabase.name: Steel!
questDatabase.description: Steel is made in a Immersive Engineering blast furnace by placing both iron and coal coke inside of it, and waiting. Steel is very commonly used, so be sure to stock up! Please check the Engineer's Manual  for more details and for instructions on how to create the Blast Furnace multiblock structure.

questDatabase.name: Windmills
questDatabase.description: To generate power, we can use a windmill.  A windmill will generate more power the higher it is placed. Before you can pull power out of a windmill, you will need to make a Kinetic Dynamo (covered in the next quest).

questDatabase.name: Watermills
questDatabase.description: To generate power, we can use a Watermill. Watermills are difficult to build properly, but are much more reliable than windmills. Up to three watermills may be placed in a row, and water must be run over them to generate power. The more water running over one side of the watermill, the better. Before we can pull power out of the watermill, we will need to make a Kinetic Dynamo (covered in the next quest)

questDatabase.name: Making Electricity
questDatabase.description: Before we can pull power out of our wind/watermills, we will need to make a Kinetic Dynamo. Once the dynamo is made, place it where you want your wind/watermill to start, then place the wind/watermill directly on the side with the small grey square. Transfering power will be covered in the next quest.

questDatabase.name: Heating Furnaces with Electricity
questDatabase.description:
To save on fuel, we can use power to heat our furnaces! First, make a Furnace heater, and attach it to a furnace, then whack one side of the heater with an Immersive Engineering hammer to designate where power will come in. Next put a LV connecter on the power input of the External Heater, then a LV connecter on your Kinetic Dynamo's power output (on the top). If done properly, power should now transfer between the Kinetic Dynamo and the External Heater. The furnace will consume power whenever there is something to smelt in the furnace.

NOTE: Beware of overloading wires, wires will burn out if too much power goes through them. Check the Engineer's Manual for load limits of different types of wires, and/or use a different means conveying the electricity such as enderio conduits.

questDatabase.name: Making a Plate Press
questDatabase.description: Hammering ingots into plates is both annoying and inneficient. We can do better, and use half resources per plate by making a Plate Press. Refer to the Engineer's Manual on how to construct a multiblock plate press to save you future headaches. You can combine the silver and gold grit received from the previous quest to make electrum to help make the press.

questDatabase.name: Finally, a Proper Bucket!
questDatabase.description: About time.

questDatabase.name: We need a name.
questDatabase.description: Make a sign, and name your outpost!

questDatabase.name: Water Tanks
questDatabase.description: Infinite water sources no longer exsist in this pack. There are a few ways to collect water without turning the world into a desert. The easiest for early game being the Railcraft Water Tank. The tank is a multiblock structure made of Water Tank Sidings, 3x3x3 and hollow in the middle.

questDatabase.name: Agricultural Research
questDatabase.description: We're going to need to crossbreed many plants together to get the produce we need. This will require us to keep a Agricultural Journal.

questDatabase.name: Cooking utensils
questDatabase.description: You're going to need some special tools to make certain dishes. Best to make them all now. When we have a kitchen, we can hang them on tool racks for easy access.

questDatabase.name: Cooking for Blockheads
questDatabase.description: Remembering cooking recipes can be a pain in the rear, especially with how many different meal options there are. Making a book which can detect what foods we can currently cook will help make cooking easier. You can make the Cooking for Blockheads book by cooking a book in a furnace.

questDatabase.name: Making a Kitchen
questDatabase.description: A kitchen is an extremely useful place to have in any home or buisness. It's much easier to prepare and cook foods with one.

questDatabase.name: Analyzing Seeds
questDatabase.description: You'll need to analyze seeds to find benificial mutations in your plants.

questDatabase.name: Using rotten food
questDatabase.description: Rotten food isn't completely useless. It can be combined with a bucket of spoiled milk to make slimeballs.

questDatabase.name: Making cooking easier
questDatabase.description: There's a second version of the Cooking for Blockheads book, which can directly craft foods for you! You can make things even easier by using a Cooking Table, which will craft foods for you and scan all connected kitchen blocks!

questDatabase.name: Crossbreeding Sugarcane
questDatabase.description: A good starter crop to crossbreed is sugarcane. To make sugarcane seeds, place cropsticks on two plots of farmland with exactly one block of sand in between the two. Place wheat seeds on one plot, then carrot seeds on the other. When they are fully grown, place two sets of crop sticks on the sand block. With a bit of luck, they will make a sugar cane plant in the middle.

questDatabase.name: Soybeans!
questDatabase.description: Soy is an immensly useful crop which can be used to substitute many animal products. It's much easier to keep a soybean crop than it is to ranch animals. In order to fully process soy, you'll need to make a presser. A presser can  squeeze soybeans into firm tofu (a substitute for meat), and firm tofu into soy milk and silken tofu.

questDatabase.name: Scallions
questDatabase.description: Crossbreeding carrots and sugarcane will yeild scallions. Scallions can be combined with a baked potato to make a good early game meal.

questDatabase.name: Food preservation
questDatabase.description: Food goes bad pretty quickly, you'll want to add a freezer or two to your kitchen to keep your food from spoiling.

questDatabase.name: Fruit Trees
questDatabase.description: Strangely, combining a sapling with 4 of the same fruit makes a fruit tree sapling of that fruit. Fruit trees require a lot of space, but are a very low maintenence way of growing snacks. Juicing fruit before consumption will make a better snack.

questDatabase.name: More fruit!
questDatabase.description: Fruit is sweet and wonderful, a small orchard of fruit trees will add many new options for your future meals.

questDatabase.name: Irrigation and greenhousing
questDatabase.description: Adding an irrigation system above your crops will make them grow faster. They'll grow even faster if they're enclosed in a building with a glass ceiling!

questDatabase.name: Flower dyes
questDatabase.description: Having many different types of dye available can save you a headache in the future.

questDatabase.name: Where's the water?
questDatabase.description: In order for a sink to provide water, you must hook some source of water to it, such as a railcraft water tank.

questDatabase.name: Better Chests
questDatabase.description: Reinforcing your chests with better materials will allow them to store more items.

questDatabase.name: Better Barrels
questDatabase.description: Storing chests upon chests upon chests of cobblestone can be a hassle to work with. By using barrels, we can store 64 stacks of one type of item at a time. Even more with upgrades!

questDatabase.name: Drawers
questDatabase.description: If you want to store a lot of different items in bulk, but can't stand digging through chests to find what you're looking for, there's a better way. Drawers are similar to barrels, but can hold up to 4 different types of items! Additionally you can quickly insert items from your inventory into a storage drawer network by using a drawer controller.

questDatabase.name: Upgrading barrels
questDatabase.description: Barrels are immensely useful, but what if a barrel just can't hold enough cobblestone? What if you want to void any extra items above the barrels capacity? There's an answer for that. To install an upgrade into a barrel, sneak and right click the upgrade onto it.

questDatabase.name: Moving your barrels
questDatabase.description: If you ever need to move your base from one location to another and need to bring a barrel with you, you can craft a Dolly to transport the barrel.

questDatabase.name: Upgrading Drawers
questDatabase.description: Extra storage space, or other upgrades can easily be added to drawers

questDatabase.name: Moving your Drawers
questDatabase.description: Drawers can be sealed with packing tape, then picked up for easy transport.

questDatabase.name: Simple logistics
questDatabase.description: Simple means of item locomotion will help you with automation early on. One of the most simple methods of moving items from one inventory to another is the Wooden Hopper. The Wooden Hopper works just like a normal metal hopper, however it can only output items to the inventory below it, and holds much less than a standard hopper.

questDatabase.name: Thaumcraft
questDatabase.description:
Thaumaturgy is the magic of things, and much is not known about it.

If you wish to persue this lost art, create an iron banded wooden wand, then use it on a vanilla bookshelf.

Read the Thaumonomicon, it does a great job of teaching. Have fun!

questDatabase.name: Buildcraft Pipes
questDatabase.description: Buildcraft Pipes are one of the simplist ways to transport items, fluids, and energy.

questDatabase.name: Logistics Pipes
questDatabase.description: Logistics Pipes can be incorporated into a Buildcraft Pipe network to greatly extend its capabilities.

questDatabase.name: Practical Logistics
questDatabase.description: Practical Logistics provides a simple way to create an inventory network. It is primarily used for storage management, but does have some basic options for item routing.

questDatabase.name: Inventory Panels
questDatabase.description: EnderIO provides a inventory management solution which uses conduits and is fueled by nutrient distillation.

questDatabase.name: RoC Blast Furnace
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed with Rotarycraft (RoC) You'll need to make vast amounts of HSLA steel.

questDatabase.name: Ethanol
questDatabase.description: Ethanol is an easy to make fuel which can be used to run RoC Gasoline Engines. Building an automatic ethanol production facility will greatly help with future automation.

questDatabase.name: Armor up!
questDatabase.description: Improving your armor will greatly help you survive violent encounters.

questDatabase.name: Gasoline Engine
questDatabase.description: Gasoline engines are easy to set up and use. They burn ethanol in either crystal or liquid form. Many of your first RoC machines will be powered by one.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel
questDatabase.description: Dark Steel is an alloy of Steel, Obsidian, and Coal Dust. It is used in many advanced EnderIO Machines, as well as EnderIO Tools, Armor, and Weapons.

questDatabase.name: Crafting with Lasers
questDatabase.description:
In order to make components for future machines, we'll need to build a laser assembly table. It is reccomended that you keep a LV Capacitor hooked up to it in the early days so that you don't have to wait long for the occasional component to be made.

Note: If you place a chest next to the Assembly Table, any items it creates will be placed in the chest instead of on the ground.

questDatabase.name: Converting Power
questDatabase.description: Rotational power can be difficult to transfer. Converting it into RF will not only allow us to move power easily, but also incorporate it into larger networks.

questDatabase.name: Storing Energy
questDatabase.description: By creating a Capacitor Bank, you can store RF power for later use.

questDatabase.name: SAG Mill
questDatabase.description: A SAG mill is used to crush ores and ingots into dust. This is primarily used to make alloys, however Silicone can also be made by crushing sand.

questDatabase.name: Metal Flakes
questDatabase.description: Making a grinder and powering it with a gasoline engine will increase your ore yields substantially.

questDatabase.name: Alloy Smelter
questDatabase.description: An Alloy Smelter can be used to melt two or more metals into an alloy.

questDatabase.name: Conduits
questDatabase.description: EnderIO conduits can greatly improve your item, fluid, and energy locomotion. They are slightly more expensive than other options, but have many means of customization and filtering, as well as the ability to stack on conduits of different types.

questDatabase.name: Dark Steel Equipment
questDatabase.description: Equipment made from Dark Steel can be upgraded with special enchantments, such as being able to store power, and remove power instead of durability on use! Empowered equipment often has a bonus effect as long as it holds energy.

questDatabase.name: Extra Pockets
questDatabase.description: Through Thaumaturgy, you can find a means to artifially expand your personal inventory space by carrying magical bags.

questDatabase.name: Upgrades and Capacitors
questDatabase.description: Capacitors can be inserted into EnderIO machines to speed them up, and increase the amount of power the machine can hold.

questDatabase.name: Botania and You
questDatabase.description: Flowers are amazing, trust me.

questDatabase.name: Flower Magic
questDatabase.description: By creating and using a petal apothecary, you can make a pure daisy, a flower which will convert stone into livingstone, and logs into livingwood, both of which you'll need to continue in Botania. To create the Pure Daisy, fill the Petal Apothecary with water, then add 4 Mystical White Petals by dropping them on the apothecary, then drop a seed in.

questDatabase.name: Mana Pools
questDatabase.description:
You can store Mana by using Mana Pools. To make a Mana Pool, you will need Livingrock. To make Livingrock, place stone in a circle around a Pure Daisy and wait one minute. Generating mana will be covered in the next quest.

NOTE: This quest requires specifically the Wand of the Forest which has two white petals.

questDatabase.name: Making Mana
questDatabase.description:
Before you can generate Mana, you'l need a way to move Mana into your Mana Pool. Make a Mana Spreader, and place it so that it faces the Mana Pool. You can place the Mana Spreader a short distance away from your Mana Pool, however after a certain range, the Mana Burst used to transfer the Mana will begin to lose Mana. Placing it too far will result in the Mana Spreader not sending Mana Bursts at all!

After placing your Mana Spreader, make an Endoflame using the Petal Apothecary. An Endoflame is a type of Mana Generating flower which consumes combustable items and produces mana. After you create the Endoflame, place it next to the Mana Spreader, and drop a combustable item onto it.

If you done everything correctly, your Mana Pool will begin to fill with Mana, a strange blue liquid.

questDatabase.name: Manasteel Equipment
questDatabase.description:
To make Manasteel, drop a piece of Steel into a Mana Pool when it has enough Mana inside of it.

Manasteel can be used to make versatile equipment which will not break as long as you have an item containing Mana in your inventory to repair it.

You can fill Mana-containing items by dropping them on a Mana Pool, then using a wand of the forest to toggle the Mana Pool into Fill mode.

questDatabase.name: A Simple Firearm
questDatabase.description: You don't currently have the resources to make more 9mm ammo. A primitive Hand Cannon will help you defend yourself until you can make more ammo and better firearms.

questDatabase.name: Prerequisites for a Matter Energy Network
questDatabase.description: Considered a neccecity to some, Matter Energy networks can make inventory and fluid management much less of a headache. Unfortunately, You'll need to collect quite a bit of resources to make one.

questDatabase.name: Pulsars
questDatabase.description: Pulsars are an easy way to provide a small amount of power to wooden transport pipes, saving space which would otherwise be used by an engine. NOTE: The gate listed has an Autarchic Pulsar installed!

questDatabase.name: Larger ME networks
questDatabase.description: If you're looking to use a ME network to automate item locomotion and crafting, you'll need a larger ME network. ME networks larger than 8 channels require a ME controller to function. We reccomend looking up tutorials on YouTube for further informatiuon.

questDatabase.name: Basic ME Networks
questDatabase.description: You can create a basic ME network for early storage needs as long as you don't exceed 8 channels on the network. Each device you hook into the network will take up one channel. NOTE: In order to effeciently provide energy to your ME network, feed it with rotational energy from Rotarycraft. All other forms of power will lose three quarters of the power fed into the ME network!

questDatabase.name: Crafting Terminals
questDatabase.description: For further ease of access, ME terminals can be upgraded to Crafting Terminals. Crafting Terminals have NEI integration, so if you wish to quickly craft something from NEI, bring up its recipe, then shift click the question mark near the crafting recipe. The Crafting Terminal will automatically populate the recipe if you have all the required items.

questDatabase.name: Sharing the Knowledge
questDatabase.description:
Instead of using a magical book which only shows each person what they know. Why not make a copy of your knowledge in a form of a book, and fill your friends minds with potentially forbidden knowledge?

Nothing could go wrong, especially if they unleash Magically Imbued Fire upon the world!

questLines.name: The Basics
questLines.description: Welcome to Revolution|3! Here's a set of quests to help you get started.

questLines.name: Farming and Cooking
questLines.description: There's no grocery stores or fast food. Best learn how to sustain yourself!

questLines.name: Industry and Automation
questLines.description: It's time to start building automated systems, or at least prepare the foundation for them!

questLines.name: Storage and Logistics
questLines.description: Chests and hoppers alone are simply not enough to meet your storage and logistic needs.

questLines.name: Magic and MORE MAGIC
questLines.description: More dangerous than playing with fire!
